pr_title: Add support for ignoring nulls in JsonDataEncoder

timeline.author: rlazo

replies.bodyText: The reason I didn't go with that approach is that, in the case ignoreNullValues is true, and o is not null, it will be null-checked a second time unnecessarily.
replies.author: mrwillis21

replies.bodyText: Actually, both methods internalAdd and internalAddIgnoreNullValues have a if (o == null) condition, so the second check still happens.
replies.author: rlazo

replies.bodyText: Yes, in either case, o gets null-checked once. But if I just added that line to the original method, o would get null-checked again after jsonWriter.name(name);
replies.author: mrwillis21

replies.bodyText:
TL;DR; LGTM
Long form: Actually, the conditional will short-circuit if ignoreNullValues==false, so the "first check" will only happen when ignoreNullValues=true and o != null, which most like is going to be most common case :-)
replies.author: rlazo

replies.bodyText:
I think this is essentially what I was saying before. :) And I agree, it will most likely be the common case when ignoreNullValues is true.

The reason I didn't go with that approach is that, in the case ignoreNullValues is true, and o is not null, it will be null-checked a second time unnecessarily.
replies.author: mrwillis21

timeline.message: Add support for ignoring nulls in JsonDataEncoder
Add to API file and bump version
Replace dynamic dispatch with simpler 'if' check
